Class ButtonReaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • src.ButtonReaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

    class ButtonReaction
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
    Object for the actions of the draw-buttons

        Static varable for the frame

      • colorScheme

        private int colorScheme
        Object variable for the color scheme that is to be drawn when the button is pressed. 1 = original image 2 = grayscale 3 = pattern

    • Constructor Detail

      • ButtonReaction

        public ButtonReaction(java.lang.String i,
                      javax.swing.JFrame f,
                      int s)
        Constructor for a new button reaction. The images for a new object are only generated once to save computing power.
        Parameters:
        i - the name of the image that is to be displayed
        f - the frame in which the image is to be displayed
        s - the desired color scheme

    • Method Detail

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        The desired event when the button is pressed. In this case, all pre-existing images in the frame are removed, then the image is drawn in the given color scheme.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mouseClicked in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
